lines.text: Asiana Airlines of South Korea has restricted
not allowed to smoke on services of less than
smoking on its services further. Passengers are
6.5 hours as of January 1994.
This ban impacts 17 flights.
x
/ESMERK/ENGLISH/EN.AJK
Corporate Issues
UK: AIR POLLUTION MORE HARMFUL THAN SMOKING?
The Times, 12 Jan 1994, p.7:-
Dr Jon Ayres, one of the UK's leading doctors,
has announced that air pollution may be
affecting more people's health than smoking.
Cases of asthma are increasing, despite the air
being cleaner than a decade ago. Ayres is just
one of the doctors now studying the mixture of
chemicals which can trigger ill health, such as
car fumes and house dust.
The extended article goes on to look at the
issue in greater detail, and also looks at US
research on air pollution death rates, and the
need for the government to invest GBP
100mn/year on new more environment friendly
buses.
/ESMERK/ENGLISH/EN.DEB
Ref: 012Vee4v5878
Part II to follow in separate profs.
